intro: Bidens ambigua, commonly known as the common beggar's ticks, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its opposite, hairy leaves and yellow flowers with five petals. The plant produces small, hairy seeds that are often dispersed by attaching to animal fur or clothing. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, roadsides, and along stream banks. Bidens ambigua is a common weed in agricultural areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
